data.name: InvalidQuery
data.value: The Query string supplied was invalid or improperly formed

data.name: InvalidQueryDuplicatedToken
data.value: The Query string supplied was invalid because it contains a duplicate token

data.name: InvalidQueryNullToken
data.value: The Query string supplied was invalid because a supplied token was null

data.name: WorkerThreadWakeupFailed
data.value: Unable to wakeup the worker thread to create an object in MTA

data.name: ClassNameNotInitializedException
data.value: ClassName not initialized.

data.name: ClassNameNotFoundException
data.value: Class name does not match.

data.name: CommentAttributeProperty
data.value: Every property added to the class for WMI property has attributes set to define its behavior in Visual Studio designer and also to define a TypeConverter to be used.

data.name: CommentAutoCommitProperty
data.value: Property to show the commit behavior for the WMI object. If true, WMI object will be automatically saved after each property modification.(ie. Put() is called after modification of a property).

data.name: CommentClassBegin
data.value: An Early Bound class generated for the WMI class.

data.name: CommentConstructors
data.value: Below are different overloads of constructors to initialize an instance of the class with a WMI object.

data.name: CommentCreatedClass
data.value: Private property to hold the name of WMI class which created this class.

data.name: CommentCreatedWmiNamespace
data.value: Private property to hold the WMI namespace in which the class resides.

data.name: CommentCurrentObject
data.value: The current WMI object used

data.name: CommentDateConversionFunction
data.value: Datetime conversion functions ToDateTime and ToDmtfDateTime are added to the class to convert DMTF datetime to System.DateTime and vice-versa.

data.name: CommentEmbeddedObject
data.value: Private variable to hold the embedded property representing the instance.

data.name: CommentEnumeratorImplementation
data.value: Enumerator implementation for enumerating instances of the class.

data.name: CommentFlagForEmbedded
data.value: Flag to indicate if the instance is an embedded object.

data.name: CommentGetInstances
data.value: Different overloads of GetInstances() help in enumerating instances of the WMI class.

data.name: CommentIsPropNull
data.value: Functions Is<PropertyName>Null() are used to check if a property is NULL.

data.name: CommentLateBoundObject
data.value: Underlying lateBound WMI object.

data.name: CommentLateBoundProperty
data.value: Property returning the underlying lateBound object.

data.name: CommentManagementPath
data.value: The ManagementPath of the underlying WMI object.

data.name: CommentManagementScope
data.value: ManagementScope of the object.

data.name: CommentOriginNamespace
data.value: Property returns the namespace of the WMI class.

data.name: CommentPrivateAutoCommit
data.value: Member variable to store the 'automatic commit' behavior for the class.

data.name: CommentPrototypeConverter
data.value: TypeConverter to handle null values for ValueType properties

data.name: CommentResetProperty
data.value: Functions Reset<PropertyName> are added for Nullable Read/Write properties. These functions are used by VS designer in property browser to set a property to NULL.

data.name: CommentShouldSerialize
data.value: Functions ShouldSerialize<PropertyName> are functions used by VS property browser to check if a particular property has to be serialized. These functions are added for all ValueType properties ( properties of type Int32, BOOL etc.. which cannot be set to null). These functions use Is<PropertyName>Null function. These functions are also used in the TypeConverter implementation for the properties to check for NULL value of property so that an empty value can be shown in Property browser in case of Drag and Drop in Visual studio.

data.name: CommentStaticManagementScope
data.value: Private member variable to hold the ManagementScope which is used by the various methods.

data.name: CommentStaticScopeProperty
data.value: Public static scope property which is used by the various methods.

data.name: CommentSystemObject
data.value: Property pointing to an embedded object to get System properties of the WMI object.

data.name: CommentSystemPropertiesClass
data.value: Embedded class to represent WMI system Properties.

data.name: CommentTimeSpanConvertionFunction
data.value: Time interval functions ToTimeSpan and ToDmtfTimeInterval are added to the class to convert DMTF Time Interval to System.TimeSpan and vice-versa.

data.name: CommentToDateTime
data.value: Converts a given datetime in DMTF format to System.DateTime object.

data.name: CommentToDmtfDateTime
data.value: Converts a given System.DateTime object to DMTF datetime format.

data.name: CommentToDmtfTimeInterval
data.value: Converts a given System.TimeSpan object to DMTF Time interval format.

data.name: CommentToTimeSpan
data.value: Converts a given time interval in DMTF format to System.TimeSpan object.

data.name: EmbeddedComment
data.value: If the embedded property is strongly typed then, to strongly type the property to the type of

data.name: EmbeddedComment2
data.value: the embedded object, you have to do the following things.

data.name: EmbeddedComment3
data.value: \t1. Generate Managed class for the WMI class of the embedded property. This can be done with MgmtClassGen.exe tool or from Server Explorer.

data.name: EmbeddedComment4
data.value: \t2. Include the namespace of the generated class.

data.name: EmbeddedComment5
data.value: \t3. Change the property get/set functions so as return the instance of the Managed class.

data.name: EmbeddedComment6
data.value: Below is a sample code.

data.name: EmbeddedComment7
data.value: VB Code

data.name: EmbeddedComment8
data.value: C# Code

data.name: EmbeddedCSharpComment1
data.value: public <ManagedClassName of Embedded property> <PropertyName>

data.name: EmbeddedCSharpComment10
data.value: \t\tIf (AutoCommitProp == true && isEmbedded == false)

data.name: EmbeddedCSharpComment11
data.value: \t\t{

data.name: EmbeddedCSharpComment12
data.value: \t\t\tPrivateLateBoundObject.Put();

data.name: EmbeddedCSharpComment13
data.value: \t\t}

data.name: EmbeddedCSharpComment3
data.value: \tget

data.name: EmbeddedCSharpComment5
data.value: \t\treturn new <ManagedClassName of Embedded property>((System.Management.ManagementBaseObject)(curObj["<PropertyName>"]));

data.name: EmbeddedCSharpComment7
data.value: \tset

data.name: EmbeddedCSharpComment9
data.value: \t\tcurObj["<PropertyName>"] = value.LateBoundObject;

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment1
data.value: Public Property <PropertyName>() As <ManagedClassName of Embedded property>

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment10
data.value: \tEnd Set

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment2
data.value: \tGet

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment3
data.value: \t\tReturn New <ManagedClassName of Embedded Property>(CType(curObj("<PropertyName>"),System.Management.ManagementBaseObject))

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment4
data.value: \tEnd Get

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment5
data.value: \tSet(ByVal Value As <ManagedClassName of Embedded property>)

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment6
data.value: \t\tcurObj("EObject")=Value.LateBoundObject

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment7
data.value: \t\tIf (AutoCommitProp = True And isEmbedded = False) Then

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment8
data.value: \t\t\tPrivateLateBoundObject.Put()

data.name: EmbeddedVisualBasicComment9
data.value: \t\tEnd If

data.name: EmptyFilePathException
data.value: FilePath cannot be empty.

data.name: NamespaceNotInitializedException
data.value: Namespace not initialized.

data.name: NullFilePathException
data.value: FilePath or code generator object is null.

data.name: UnableToCreateCodeGeneratorException
data.value: Unable to create code generator for '{0}'

data.name: PlatformNotSupported_SystemManagement
data.value: System.Management currently is only supported for Windows desktop applications.

data.name: PlatformNotSupported_FullFrameworkRequired
data.value: Could not find an installation of .NET Framework v4.0.30319. System.Management requires native modules from the .NET Framework to operate.

data.name: LoadLibraryFailed
data.value: Failed to load required native library '{0}'.

data.name: PlatformNotSupported_FrameworkUpdatedRequired
data.value: The native library '{0}' does not have all required functions. Please, update the .NET Framework.
